sourceMeaningMnemonic: <radical>Past</radical> <radical>stamp</radical>s usually depict images <kanji>contrary</kanji> to current views.
meaningInfo: Look at this stamp. There's Columbus being hugged by a bunch of South American natives. Yikes, that's contrary to how things went, that's for sure.
readingMnemonic: Don't be the type of person who acts <kanji>contrary</kanji> to how they should and instead be like <reading>Kyaku</reading> (<ja>きゃく</ja>) the customer. They're always so nice and polite and they don't give diseases to entire populations of people.
readingInfo: Be contrary to the evildoers of the past and be like Kyaku instead.
